A11.description: A stack of interactve headings, used to display further information when opened, each item has a closed and open state
A11.usage:
• Do not mix styles of accordions on a page e.g. use all variants with a background or all variants with an outline
  • Max width on desktop 934px
  • Link variants do not expand

A21.description: Used to draw attention to important information for the user globally
A21.usage:
• Do not stack Global Alerts, limit of one per page
  • Global Alert must be placed above the masthead
  • Use the relevant variant
  • Keep alert text short and succinct (should be no longer than one sentence)
  • Text should link to relevant content

A22.description: Used to draw attention to important information for the user on the page
A22.usage:
• Limit of two In Page Alerts per page
  • In Page Alerts must be placed at the top of page content, but below the page banner and screen reader
  • Use the relevant variant
  • Keep alert text short and succinct (should be no longer than one sentence)
  • Text should link to relevant content

B11.description: Buttons are used to give the user the ability to interact with the website
B11.usage:
• Use the "primary" variant as the default option when creating pages
  • When buttons are grouped next to each other ensure there is a minimum 24px margin on desktop and 16px on tablet/mobile

B12.description: A link is to be used to take the user to a specific location, it could be a page or resource
B12.usage:
• White inline Links are to be used in footer content
  • Links to external websites must include the icon <class="fa-solid fa-up-right-from-square"></i>

PC1.description: Container element that holds rows of individual cards

C11.description: Cards are a container filled with content about a single subject, used to help users scan and navigate through content quickly
C11.hierarchy: • Cards must always be rendered within a <div class="act-card-grid">
C11.usage:
• Do not mix card variants in a row e.g. use all primary cards or all icon cards
  • Homepage variant with image feature to be used on homepages only
  • Maximum 4 cards per row at the desktop breakpoint

C12.description: Cards are a container filled with content about a single subject, used to help users scan and navigate through content quickly
C12.hierarchy: • Cards must always be rendered within a <div class="act-card-grid">
C12.usage:
• Do not mix card variants in a row e.g. use all primary cards or all icon cards
  • Primary variant with image feature to be used on homepages only
  • Maximum 4 cards per row at the desktop breakpoint

C21.description: Used on content pages to help visually break up the page as well as calling out important information

C22.description: Used at the start of content pages to summarise the key points to help people find information quickly

C23.description: Used on content pages to help visually break up the page as well as calling out important information
C23.usage:
• Do not stack quotes
  • Limit of one quote per paragraph

F11.description: Used at the bottom of all pages to display - related links and other relevant information
F11.hierarchy: Footers must always be rendered inside a <footer class="act-footer">
F11.usage:
• Must be the final element on the page
  • Do not modify the colours

F12.description: Acknowledgment of Country footer to used at the bottom of all pages
F12.hierarchy: Footers must always be rendered inside a <footer class="act-footer">
F12.usage:
• Always place above the Main Footer
  • Do not modify the colours

F13.description: Used on content pages to receive feedback to help continually improve ACT pages and components
F13.hierarchy: Footers must always be rendered inside a <footer class="act-footer">
F13.usage:
• Always place above the Acknowledgement Footer
  • Used on content pages
  • Do not modify the colours

F21.hierarchy: Input fields must always be rendered inside a <form class="act-form">

F22.description: To give users the ability to choose from predefined choices, or when used single to have user check/ uncheck an option
F22.hierarchy: Checkboxes must always be rendered inside a <form class="act-form">

PF2.description: Acknowledgment of Country footer to used at the bottom of all pages
PF2.usage: • Footers should always be the last elements on the page

T11.description: Used to structure data in columns and rows, helpful when a user needs to compare a large amount of content
T11.hierarchy: Tables must always be rendered inside a <div class="act-table-container">
T11.usage:
• Only use tables as neccesary
  • Tables to scroll horizontally on smaller screens
  • Column widths can be adjusted to best fit content
  • Avoid using tables where possible, only use when necessary to present data

W11.description: Used as a place for secondary links and to show unity within ACT websites
W11.usage:
• Max limit of 1 button
  • Max limit of 3 links
  • Skip to content button to be hidden, only being shown here as a visual example
  • Do not change the background colour
  • Can change the button colour based on it‚Äôs needs

W12.description: Used to help users navigate the website through the menu button
W12.usage:
• ACT Government logo to link to ‚Äòhttps://www.act.gov.au/‚Äô
  • Secondary logo to link to current websites homepage e.g. Access Canberra logo in this example
  • Default Menu Button purple, can be changed with approval from design system team

W15.description: Used to help users navigate the website via a collection of links
W15.usage: • Do not change the colour of this component

W16.description: A list of links, showing current page in the website hierarchy, used to help the user navigate a website
W16.usage: • Split breadcrumbs over multiple rows when it becomes too long
